meanings.definition: A watery mixture of insoluble matter.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers poured a slurry of sand and water into the hole.
meanings.sent2: The farmer spread a slurry of fertilizer on the field to help the crops grow.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they accidentally stepped into the slurry of mud and water.
meanings.sent4: The polluted river looked like a slurry of chemicals and waste flowing downstream.
meanings.sent5: The artist mixed a colorful slurry of paint to create a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To cover or fill with slurry.
meanings.sent1: The workers will slurry the road to make it smooth and durable.
meanings.sent2: She decided to slurry the driveway with gravel for better traction.
meanings.sent3: The chef will slurry the dish with a delicious sauce before serving.
meanings.sent4: The gardener will slurry the flower bed with mulch to protect the plants.
meanings.sent5: He used a brush to slurry the wall with a fresh coat of paint.

meanings.definition: A semi-liquid mixture, typically of fine particles of manure, cement, or coal suspended in water.
meanings.sent1: The workers pumped a slurry of cement and water into the foundation.
meanings.sent2: The farmer stored a slurry of manure in the barn for fertilizing the fields.
meanings.sent3: The prankster filled the water balloons with a slurry of mud and grass clippings.
meanings.sent4: The factory released a slurry of coal dust into the air, causing pollution.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied a slurry of microscopic particles under the microscope.
